channel.title: protocol on Daniele Antonioli
channel.description: Recent content in protocol on Daniele Antonioli

item.title: KNOB
item.description: The Key Negotiation Of Bluetooth (KNOB) attack exploits the fact that the specification of Bluetooth includes an encryption key negotiation protocol that allows to negotiate encryption keys with entropy as low as 1 Byte, without protecting the integrity of the negotiation process. A remote attacker can manipulate the entropy negotiation to let any standard compliant Bluetooth device negotiate encryption keys with 1 byte of entropy, and then brute force the low entropy keys in real time. The KNOB attack is listed as CVE-2019-9506.

item.title: REarby
item.description: REarby is a toolkit that I developed to reverse engineer and attack Google’s Nearby Connections.
